raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are extracting factual relations from a medical imaging lecture. Use only information grounded in the input SLIDE_TEXT.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
Whenever you can, avoid loops — and write in matrix form.
Instead of looping to square elements, just write “A dot caret 2”.
Want row-wise sums? Use “sum of A, comma 2”.
Need probabilities per row? Divide each row by its total using matrix broadcasting — it’s cleaner and faster than nested loops.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Output a triple only if both subject and object appear verbatim in SLIDE_TEXT (case-insensitive).
- Predicates must be one of: uses | via | represents | depends_on | measures | produces | reconstructs_with.
- Add modalities ["text"] by default; add "image" only if clearly visible without the text.
- Confidence in [0,1].

OUTPUT:
{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"<verbatim subject>", "p":"uses|via|represents|depends_on|measures|produces|reconstructs_with",
     "o":"<verbatim object>", "modalities":["text","image"], "confidence":0.0, "evidence":"<short quote from SLIDE_TEXT>"}
  ]
}

assistant
{
  "triples": [
    {
      "s": "A dot caret 2",
      "p": "uses",
      "o": "loops",
      "modalities": ["text"],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "Instead of looping to square elements, just write \"A dot caret 2\"."
    },
    {
      "s": "sum of A, comma 2",
      "p": "uses",
      "o": "loops",
      "modalities": ["text"],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "Want row-wise sums? Use \"sum of A, comma 2\"."
    },
    {
      "s": "A./repmat(ASUM, 1, size(A,2))",
      "p": "uses",
      "o": "loops",
      "modalities": ["text"],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "Need probabilities per row? Divide each row by its total using matrix broadcasting — it’s cleaner and faster than nested loops."
    }
  ]
}

triples.evidence: Instead of looping to square elements, just write "A dot caret 2".
Want row-wise sums? Use "sum of A, comma 2".
